alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Hall (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 11:50PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Buffalo and northwestern Hall Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1149 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gibbon, or 9 miles northeast of Kearney, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. Radar is also showing weak rotation in this area, although the threat for a tornado is currently considered low. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gibbon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central and central Nebraska.
